unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India

unnormalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India continues at an accelerated pace, driven by both public and private sector initiatives. Bharat Fiber, a key program under the Ministry of Communications, aims to connect every Gram Panchayat by March 31st, 2024, with high-speed internet.
normalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India continues at an accelerated pace, driven by both public and private sector initiatives. Bharat Fiber, a key program under the Ministry of Communications, aims to connect every Gram Panchayat by March thirty first, two thousand and twenty four, with high-speed internet.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio Infocomm announced on November 15th, 2023, further expansion plans, committing Rs. 30,000 crore to enhance its JioFiber network, particularly in Tier II and Tier III cities. Airtel is also aggressively competing, adding roughly 1.5 million home passes per quarter.
normalised: Reliance Jio Infocomm announced on November fifteenth, two thousand and twenty three, further expansion plans, committing rupees thirty thousand crore to enhance its JioFiber network, particularly in Tier two and Tier three cities. Airtel is also aggressively competing, adding roughly one point five million home passes per quarter.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT-Madras believe FTTH will be critical for supporting India's digital economy and enabling services like telemedicine and e-learning in rural areas. Concerns remain, however, regarding last-mile connectivity challenges in geographically difficult terrains, like the Himalayan region.
normalised: Experts at I I T-Madras believe F T T H will be critical for supporting India's digital economy and enabling services like telemedicine and e-learning in rural areas. Concerns remain, however, regarding last-mile connectivity challenges in geographically difficult terrains, like the Himalayan region.

unnormalised: Initial reports suggest a significant uptick in broadband subscriptions during Diwali (14/11/2023) as families sought faster connectivity for entertainment and communication. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is expected to release its Q3 2023 report on FTTH penetration by 17:00 hrs on December 15, 2023.
normalised: Initial reports suggest a significant uptick in broadband subscriptions during Diwali (fourteenth November two thousand and twenty three) as families sought faster connectivity for entertainment and communication. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is expected to release its Quarter three two thousand and twenty three report on F T T H penetration by seventeen hundred hours on December fifteenth, two thousand and twenty three.
